perturbation.original_text:
All Work shall be performed on the basis of certain agreed upon prices specified in the related Exhibit or individual Purchase Order once accepted by Subcontractor.

B. Payment. EDGE shall pay Subcontractor for Work completed in accordance with the related Exhibit or individual Purchase Order once accepted by Subcontractor.
perturbation.changed_text:
All Work shall be performed on the basis of certain agreed upon prices specified in the related Exhibit or individual Purchase Order once accepted by Subcontractor.

B. Payment. EDGE shall pay Subcontractor for Work completed in accordance with the related Exhibit or individual Purchase Order within 90 days of acceptance by Subcontractor.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction. Section 4.A establishes that payment is based on agreed-upon prices. However, Section 4.B originally stated EDGE shall pay Subcontractor for completed work. By adding a 'within 90 days' clause, it creates a contradiction as it does not clarify when the payment should start for the subcontractor.

perturbation.original_text: Subcontractor shall be permitted to subcontract any part of the Work without the prior written notification and consent of EDGE. However, Subcontractor will follow subcontracting requirements and processes of EDGE and provide joint access to subcontractor database and information concerning quality control. All Work performed by a Lower-tier Subcontractor shall be deemed Work performed by Subcontractor. Subcontractor agrees not to hire any Lower-tier Subcontractor to whose employment EDGE reasonably objects.
perturbation.changed_text: Subcontractor shall be permitted to subcontract any part of the Work without the prior written notification and consent of EDGE. However, Subcontractor will follow subcontracting requirements and processes of EDGE and provide joint access to subcontractor database and information concerning quality control. All Work performed by a Lower-tier Subcontractor shall be deemed Work performed by Subcontractor. Subcontractor agrees not to hire any Lower-tier Subcontractor to whose employment EDGE reasonably objects. Furthermore, subcontractors require explicit permission from EDGE to ensure compliance with internal processes.
perturbation.explanation: The added sentence creates a contradiction. The original text says the Subcontractor is permitted to subcontract without written notification. The addition of the last sentence now indicates subcontractors need permission from EDGE. This contradicts the first sentence and causes confusion. Additionally, This adds legal uncertainty and potential disputes over obligations.

perturbation.original_text:
A. RIGHT TO CURE/TERMINATION FOR SUBCONTRACTOR'S DEFAULT

After fifteen (15) days prior written notice to Subcontractor to cure, or additional time as may be reasonably required by EDGE to cure the event of default, EDGE may terminate this Agreement, or any one or more awarded Purchase Orders and take control of the Work for such terminated Purchase Orders, including any or all materials for the Work, and may proceed with the completion of the Work as contemplated by this Agreement by whatever method deemed expedient by EDGE upon the occurrence of any of the following events, which shall be deemed events of a default by Subcontractor hereunder:
perturbation.changed_text:
A. RIGHT TO CURE/TERMINATION FOR SUBCONTRACTOR'S DEFAULT

After fifteen (15) days prior written notice to Subcontractor to cure, or EDGE may terminate this Agreement immediately, or any one or more awarded Purchase Orders and take control of the Work for such terminated Purchase Orders, including any or all materials for the Work, and may proceed with the completion of the Work as contemplated by this Agreement by whatever method deemed expedient by EDGE upon the occurrence of any of the following events, which shall be deemed events of a default by Subcontractor hereunder:
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction regarding the conditions for terminating the agreement. The original text says there is a 15 day notice period. The modified test says EDGE may terminate the agreement immediately. This contradiction creates ambiguity as to the proper termination procedure and potentially cause confusion.
